body_html:
My best guess is that the bug lies with the generic_fast_tanh_float implementation in MathFunctionsImpl.h (or something like it). The polynomial it uses is not appropriate for single precision input.

I don't know why a result is not determined exclusively by its corresponding input.
body_text:
My best guess is that the bug lies with the generic_fast_tanh_float implementation in MathFunctionsImpl.h (or something like it).  The polynomial it uses is not appropriate for single precision input.
I don't know why a result is not determined exclusively by its corresponding input.
body:
My best guess is that the bug lies with the generic_fast_tanh_float implementation in MathFunctionsImpl.h (or something like it).  The polynomial it uses is not appropriate for single precision input.

I don't know why a result is not determined exclusively by its corresponding input.
